fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- Initials avatars are not being displayed in Jira, it shows a gray silhouette instead.
- It behaves like this regardless of the privacy options at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/privacy

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Aa to do this test and make sure the avatar shows the initials (using name + surname initials in latin alphabet)
 # Invite this account to Jira

h3. Expected Results
It should show the avatar as initials

h3. Actual Results
It shows a gray silhouette

 !jiraassignee.png|thumbnail! 
 !jiramenu.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This works ok in Confluence, id.atlassian.com, People section, etc

 !confluence.png|thumbnail! 
 !id-atlassian-com.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Initials avatars are not being displayed in Jira, it shows a gray silhouette instead

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Groups that are added to Confluence Administration access will count towards billing licenses even if the users from these groups don't have Confluence Product access. With this, they will fill the seats of the application but won't be able to access Confluence.
h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add only confluence-users to your Confluence Product access
 # Add a group ( let's call it 'Permission test' ) to Confluence Administration access
 # Add users to the group 'Permission test' ( don't add the users to confluence-users' group )
 # Try to access Confluence

h3. Expected Results

The users will be able to access Confluence, or at least the Confluence administration ( https://<your site>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/viewgeneralconfig.action ). Or the users won't count towards Confluence license.
h3. Actual Results

Users count towards Confluence licenses and when they try to access Confluence they'll receive the following request access image:

!Screen Shot 2019-06-10 at 10.48.31.png|thumbnail!

Their number will also be displayed at the Admin Hub UI, but they won't be found at the Admin Hub users search. Basically, let's say you have 50 confluence-users and only 1 Permission test user, you'll see 51 users' in your license count, and when you filter your Admin Hub search as:

!Screen Shot 2019-06-10 at 11.05.37.png|thumbnail!

The UI will only display 50 users ( the ones with Product access ).
h3. Workaround

Add the same groups from Administration access to Product access, or add the users to a group with Product access so that your administrators can access the application.
fields.summary: Administration access groups add licenses even without product access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way to track who/when each products were activated or deactivated.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a part of site management, it will be great if there is a site-admin level audit log to track product activation/deactivation

h3. Note
Site admins can check which products are currently activated by navigating to "Billing" > "Manage subscriptions"
fields.summary: Site-admin level audit log to track product activation/deactivation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The User export feature only shows the first 100 groups(equivalent to the 5º page of the UI). The other groups cannot be used to export users or be found in the select list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have more than 100 groups in your instance
# At the users' page hit the *Export Users* button.
# At the *Users from selected groups only* select list try to find the groups that are at 6º onward on the group's page.

h3. Expected Results

All groups should be selected.

h3. Actual Results

Only 100 groups are loaded and can be used to export users.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users export group picker only show the first 100 groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there's a comma in user's full name, part of the name (after comma) appears in wrong column in the CSV file exported from users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a comma in Atlassian account's "Full name". For example: *Test, User*
# Go to a cloud site where the user exist and export the users
# Access the file in Excel

h3. Expected Results
User's full name appears as *Test, User* in "full_name" column 

h3. Actual Results
User appears as following:
|| full_name || email ||
| Test | User |

h3. Notes
* User details appears correctly in cloud site

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Export users generate a broken CSV file if full name contains comma

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the cloud environment, only _site-admins_ can invite/remove/disable users from the cloud site however that group also provide access to the whole cloud site settings & projects by default

h3. Suggested Solutions
In some scenarios, permission that allows users to manage the user base is necessary but without the full admin access part.
fields.summary: User management permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Accented characters in the user's name are unsupported in JIRA invitation email subject

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an accented character to your full name in your Atlassian account.
# In JIRA, send an invitation request to a user

h3. Expected Results
Email subject: Test Test has invited you to Jira

h3. Actual Results
Email subject: Tést Tèst has invited you to Jira

 !T_eacute_st_T_egrave_st_has_invited_you_to_Jira_-_Atlassian_Mail.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

There is none...simply replace the accented character in your full name.
fields.summary: Accented characters in name unsupported in invitation email subject

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As a user, I have the use-case to check new user permission before they can actually login to the instance. This is to prevent the new user to see projects they're not supposed to.
h3. Suggested resolution

It is not possible to do so at the moment, it would be great if there's a feature to work around it.
fields.summary: Allowing site-admin to impersonate unverified users

fields.description:
It'd be nice to have more granular control over the administrative functions granted to Site Administrators. For example, granting people the ability to manage users and groups while protecting other functions in the site or in the applications.

Original description from reporter:
{quote}
Instead of only allowing site-administrators the ability to manage user accounts within Atlassian Cloud, there should be a user-administrators role.

We would like our Service Desk staff to have the ability to do user administration within our organization but are unable to do. We cannot give them site-administrator access as this allows them to have too much control and the potential ability to break our configurations, workflows, etc.

Overall permissions need to be more granular to allow true delegation of tasks and administration.
{quote}
fields.summary: Granular control over Site Administrator permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It seems that for Confluence and JIRA global permissions, it is shown up in the list as one of the groups.
It should be a hidden group for trusted-users in the site administration page.
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available


h3. Steps to Reproduce
For Jira:
# Login to Jira, and go to Global permissions

For Confluence :
# Login to Confluence, go to Global permissions

h3. Expected Results
No trusted users group

h3. Actual Results
Trusted user groups shows as part of the list


h3. Notes
We expect the trusted group to be a system group and should be hidden from the list.

h3.Workaround
Currently, there is no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: In Global permissions, the trusted-user group is shown up as part of the list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The pagination of Groups page breaks when there are 58 groups on the Atlassian site. The 4th page is not accessible even when it contains 1 group on it.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have 58 groups visible through the UI.
 # Try to access the 4th Page from the second or third page.

h3. Expected Results

4th Page is accessible from both the 2nd and 4th page. 
h3. Actual Results

The pagination will break and the 4th Page might be accessible from only 2nd or 3rd page(tests on two different sites gave different results).

 
h3. Workaround

Create one more dummy group or append the URL to point it to the 4th page.
fields.summary: Pagination breaks on Groups

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As per summary, allow users to be able to enable/disable push authentication for 2FA/MFA. Currently authentication requires filling 6 digits from the authenticator application and it's quite a hassle for many. Having the option to enable push login will be a great time saver.
fields.summary: Allow users to be able to enable/disable push authentication for 2FA/MFA

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Where the conditions below are met, users receive an invitation email containing a link *Join them now* which only allows them to sign up with Google account.

* Site is not integrated with G Suite
* Site admin invites the user to Confluence or Jira-and-Confluence
* The invited user uses email provited by Gmail (or G Suite)

 !Screenshot 2019-05-16 17.12.46.png|thumbnail! 

While users who are invited to Jira receive an invitation email which provides 2 options *Join with Google* and *Join with email*.

 !Screenshot 2019-05-16 17.12.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option *Join with email* to the users who are invited to Confluence.

h3. Workaround

Try the workaround below to be able to login with email and password:

# Sign up with Google integration
# Set the password at https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword

Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Provide an option "Join with email" to users invited to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment, invites lasts 7 days before it expires.
The problem is that the expired invite will still count towards the billing/licensing.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Invite users

h3. Expected Results
If the invite got expired, it shouldn't count as an active license (_considering no one is using that account as the person has not accepted the invite_)

h3. Actual Results
The expired invite still count as an active license

h3. Notes
This is somehow related to the tickets
- [(ID-6520) JIRA application access page not showing licensed users in pending invitation status|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-6520]
- [(ID-6748) Show how long an invitation was sent on the new UI for User management and if it was expired|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-6748]

More context at [(CLOUD-7198)|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-7198]

h3. Workaround
- Delete the invited user if they are not keen in accepting the invitation
- Resend invite and request the user to accept the invitation
fields.summary: Expired invite still count as an active license

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When there are no profile images set in https://id.atlassian.com, a profile icon will be set with a random color which is defined by a criteria based on the account's ID.
In some cases, this causes confusion to user.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great if users could choose which colors to use from the options of default image icons
fields.summary: Ability to set the color of default profile image

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding a new Billing/Technical contact to an Atlassian Subscription. If the user is not yet a Billing/Technical contact of any Atlassian subscription adding the user will prompt the below message:
{quote}
This contact has not been signed up. Please enter the contact's first name and last name and we will send out their new user credentials via email.
{quote}
The prompt is misleading as it's saying that the account is new even though the email has an existing Atlassian Account

h3. Suggested Solution
* Change the prompt message to convey that the user is not yet a Billing/Technical contact of any Atlassian Cloud subscription and remove the message that new user credentials will be sent through email.
fields.summary: Helpful message when adding a new Billing/Technical contact

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Searching in the admin.atlassian.com users list the field refreshes automatically causing the cursor to be removed from the field.

See the video here https://cl.ly/dfeb945aaf01

h3. Environment
Cloud (former "User management", new admin hub)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to admin.atlassian.com
# Go to the instance and the users list
# start typing a name

h3. Expected Results
It should let you type the entire name

h3. Actual Results
It refreshes when you are typing, the cursor is removed from the field and occasionally an error "Something went wrong" is displayed.

h3. Workaround
Copy and paste the complete name or email into the field at once
fields.summary: Searching in the admin.atlassian.com users list the field refreshes automatically causing the cursor to be removed from the field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to load multiple users ( around 3 + ) in different browser tabs returns the error: 

Failed to load user details
We had trouble trying to retrieve this user's details, please refresh the page to try again.

h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud User management UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Go to the Admin page of your site
# Users section
# Try to open multiple users ( 3 + ) in different browser tabs

h3. Expected Results

Users' information is loaded in each tab, and you can perform actions such as *Remove user *.

h3. Actual Results

One or two users information is loaded and the other tabs return an error such as:

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-09 at 11.18.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

As currently there's no Bulk delete option, opening users in multiple tabs then removing them would be faster than going at each one.

h3. Workaround

Search user information one by one, or use the *Export users* option to load their data on a CSV file.
fields.summary: Trying to load multiple users ( around 3 + ) in different browser tabs returns the error

fields.description:
*Problem*
When in the Product access page, in the Jira administration page, is not possible to export the users from that groups.

*Suggestion*
* Add a bullet point on the Project Access "What you need to know" box about exporting the list via the Users page Export users button.
fields.summary: Export users bullet in the Product access page

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently if you export users through site administration, the columns in the exported CSV file are fixed and it's not possible to select which columns to export. For example, the CSV file includes column for *Last active in Opsgenie* and *Last active in Stride* even if these products are not subscribed.

h3. Suggested solution
Implement the ability to select the columns to be exported.
fields.summary: Ability to include/exclude columns in Export Users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User authentication is not being handled correctly in some cases for the new JIRA comment reactions. 

h3. Environment
Cloud production

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Load a Jira issue in the new issue view.
 # Click the reactions button below a comment:
 !Screenshot 2019-05-06 at 08.37.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Reactions load and can be added to the comment

h3. Actual Results
Reactions fail to load.

Examination of the web requests from the developer console/HAR file show a POST request made to /gateway/api/reactions/view failed with a *403 Forbidden*:
 !Screenshot 2019-05-06 at 08.34.08.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This seems to be an issue with user permissions not being passed correctly. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Trying to add reactions to comments in JIRA fails with 403 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users may sometime receive a SAML login error message verify-saml-domains too-many-matching-identities

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Using a domain account with SAML-SSO configured, login into Atlassian. 

h3. Expected Results

The user should be allowed to login

h3. Actual Results

The user is presented with the error verify-saml-domains too-many-matching-identities

 !error saml.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

1. Reach out to support via https://support.atlassian.com to fix the SAML link for the affected user. 

2. While working with support to fix the SAML link, the following can be used as *temporary workaround* so that the affected user can generate a session to the cloud site and continue working. 
- Go to https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword and generate a recovery link for affected email address.
- Access the recovery email and click on *Log in to my account*
- In the browser tab that popped up, put in the URL of the cloud site https://<site>.atlassian.net
fields.summary: Users may receive a SAML login error: "too-many-identities"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 When a user has only _Confluence_/_Portal only_ access and he/she navigates to the cloud instance without specifying the /wiki endpoint (i.e. <your-cloud-site>.atlassian.net/wiki) he/she is taken to Jira which triggers the following behavior:
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solutions
Improve the error message to be more meaningful such as "you don't have access to Jira. Click here to go to Confluence".
fields.summary: Improve "Something's gone wrong" error message for permission issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new User Management admin pages, the agent license cannot be revoked from the site-admin users. Licenses can be limited and should be removable from the site-admin users. 

 !toggle.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Spin up a new cloud site with Jira Service Desk and other products. 
 # Add a new site-admin user
 # Try to revoke the agent license from the site-admin user.

h3. Expected Results

The toggle switch should allow removal of license from site-admins

h3. Actual Results

The toggle switch is disabled for the site-admin user. 

h3. Workaround

- Edit the Product Access page and remove site-admin group as an application access group.
- Revoke the application access group (ie. jira-servicedesk-user) from the site-admin user manually.
fields.summary: License cannot be revoked from the site-admin users via the toggle switch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking 'View users' next to the 'trusted-users' group in the Global permissions leads you to the groups list, instead of showing the users of that group.

 !image-2019-05-01-15-46-25-498.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Press "g+g" to open the search, type 'Global permissions' and hit enter.
 # Click 'View users' next to the 'trusted-users-<hash>' group

h3. Expected Results
It should open the group and display the users

h3. Actual Results
It shows the list of groups (but in the URL the group id is there)

h3. Notes
This happens to all groups, not only "trusted-users-..."

h3. Workaround
To find out which users are added to the Trusted group, go to User management > Users > in the "role" quickfilter, select "Trusted"
fields.summary: Clicking 'View users' next to the 'trusted-users' group in the Global permissions leads you to the groups list
Ability to configure the session timeout for managed Atlassian accounts on the Cloud
"Default Access Group" tag doesn't reflect accurate information from the database under Product Access page

fields.description:
This request is that the Atlassian account information should be the same information from the user of https://training.atlassian.com.

Currently to login in Atlassian university you must go to https://training.atlassian.com/login.html and hit the *Sign in* option, then you are redirected to https://id.atlassian.com/login to authenticate with your Atlassian account. 

The issue here is that https://training.atlassian.com has its own user base, hence if you change the email address of your Atlassian account this change won't occur at https://training.atlassian.com causing confusion.

You may see the below example:

User has the following email address *email A* on his Atlassian account, then he logs in at https://training.atlassian.com creating one university account related to *email A*. Now, this user updates his Atlassian account email from *email A* to *email B*, he then logs in at https://training.atlassian.com using *email B* but on the university, his email is still being displayed as *email A*. In order to fix this the user must change the email of the university from *email A* to *email B* as well.
fields.summary: Unify university and Atlassian Account user details

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
*Administer User* option redirects you to "Users" page instead of moving to the target user's page/account.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Hover on a user name in old issue view, for example in issue's reporter field:
 !Screenshot 2019-04-30 at 9.19.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on *More*
# Select *Administer User*

h3. Expected Results
You will be directed to the user's account

h3. Actual Results
You will be directed to *Site Administration* > *Users* page

h3. Workaround
Search for the user through *Site Administration* > *Users* page directly.
fields.summary: "Administer User" option redirects to wrong page

fields.description:
At the moment, when a new user is provisioned in a cloud site. The status of the user is shown as _Invitation Pending_ similar to manually invited users to the site. Furthermore, no email invitation is sent to the provisioned users. 

 !provisioned.png|thumbnail! 

Improve the status of the user as maybe _Newly Provisioned_.
fields.summary: Account status for provisioned users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Export users button is not working when using IE 11.
You'll see this message:
"We had trouble generating the user list - Please try again later"
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-24 at 14.13.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use Google Chrome or other browser to export users
fields.summary: Export users feature is broken on Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment, once you impersonate a user and hit the *switch back* link it will redirect you to the old User management UI which is not expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Impersonate a user through the *Log in as user* button
# Hit the switch back button from the below pop up:
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-24 at 12.31.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The user should get redirected back to the new UI:
 !Screen_Shot_2019-04-24_at_12_39_44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The user gets redirected back to the old UI:
 !Screen_Shot_2019-04-24_at_12_37_43.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Got to the *Users* section in the left and access the user profile once more.
fields.summary: After impersonating a user the *switch back* link redirects you to the old User management UI.

fields.description: As a site-admin and/or organization admin, I would like to be able to create API tokens for other users in my organization
fields.summary: create API Tokens for other users

fields.description:
Atlassian Cloud SAML currently only supports typical bindings below : 

The request for login from Atlassian to Identity Provider is HTTP Redirect
The response from Identity Provider to Atlassian is HTTP POST

Some users  have requested to use HTTP Post binding from Atlassian login to their Identity Provider. 

Workaround : 
Please try to fit the Atlassian login to Identity Provider binding method of HTTP Redirect for now.
fields.summary: Provide option for HTTP POST login from Atlassian to Identity Provider

fields.description:
*Problem*
When syncing a particular Google group, user from previous groups that were synced are deactivated.

*Suggestion*
* Give a big warning when you are going to sync ONE group, and there are already more than 2-3 groups synched
* Prevent you from doing a synch that will lock you yourself out.
fields.summary: G Suite group sync warning

fields.description: In addition to retrieving the recovery codes for 2FA via SMS or an app like Authy, it would be great if we could configure the option to retrieve them via emails instead.
fields.summary: Allow 2FA recovery codes to be sent to email as an option.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After doing a site import from either Cloud or Server the site-admin must approve the imported groups access into the applications which don't work on the new UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Execute a site-import to Cloud
 # At the product access page click on *Review imported groups*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-30 at 17.24.26.png|thumbnail!
 # At the pop up try to approve the access of the approved groups:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-30 at 17.24.37.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

After hitting the approve link the group should be added to the group access settings.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.
 !Review imported groups.gif|width=507,height=346!

h3. Workaround
You may click to reject and set up the groups on the administration tab.
fields.summary: In the new product access page it's impossible to approve the access of imported groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you are authenticated in more than one device and reset the Atlassian Account password you will only be asked to reenter the credentials on those devices after the _cloud.session.token_ expires.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Knowing that this might represent a security breach, it would be great to automatically log out of all devices after changing the Atlassian Account password.

h3. Workaround
After changing your account at https://id.atlassian.com you can:
# Navigate to the *Security* tab
# At *Recent devices* section click on _View and manage recent devices_
# In the bottom of the page you have a button "log out off all other devices"  

You can learn more about the _recent devices_ and security [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/recently-used-devices-949780185.html].
fields.summary: Automatically log out off all devices after changing the Atlassian Account password

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}


h3. Problem Definition

When you attempted email change too many times, the form shows the error below:

{quote}
Daily limit reached
We limit email changes to help keep your account safe. You can try again in 24 hours.
{quote}

However, the error message is incorrectly translated in Japanese, it basically means as follows:

{code:none}
An error occurred
We couldn't save your change. Please try the operation again.
{code}

This probably happens when the translation resource is missing and the UI falls back to the general error message.

 !Screenshot 2019-04-17 11.37.52.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2019-04-17 11.39.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Translate the error message to the browser language.
Or show the error message as is in English if the translation resource is missing.

Also, please apply the same solution to the other translated error messages if any.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Incorrect translation mapping at email change

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Atlassian accounts (id.atlassian.com) and Bitbucket Cloud accounts (bitbucket.org) have separate user systems and they also have separate 2FA systems: 
* Atlassian 2FA: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.htm|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.htm]
* Bitbucket Cloud 2FA: [Secure your account with two\-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html]

If both are enabled, the user would be forced to authenticate through 2 different 2FA screens separately.  

Note: On the Bitbucket Cloud side, if the user has enabled "Require 2FA to access content" as per [Control access to your private content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/control-access-to-your-private-content-862621261.html], this will only enforce Bitbucket Cloud 2FA and not Atlassian 2FA. 

Therefore in situations where the organization needs to enforce 2FA on Atlassian accounts and Bitbucket repositories, the users will have no choice but to go through 2 separate 2FA screens.

h3. Suggestion 
Allow users to login into bitbucket.org without authenticating through the Bitbucket Cloud 2FA if they have already authenticated through Atlassian 2FA.
fields.summary: Atlassian Accounts should allow users to bypass Bitbucket 2FA once they have already gone through the Atlassian 2FA.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Problem when turning off product access. Seems like it's on again, but actually it's off.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Video:  [^access_user_management.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Product access shows correct state (Off)

h3. Actual Results
Product access shows incorrect state sometime (On)

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page and toggle on/off the button again.
fields.summary: Turning on/off product access isn't consistent on admin.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When deleting a user in a Cloud instance, all references to the user's identity in the instance will be replaced with 'Former User'. 
This is the expected behavior but the current warming pop up doesn't advise about it.

The current warming says:
 !REMOVE_USER.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The warming message should complement the phrase "Your products will still keep all of this user's contributions." saying that the data will remain at the instance but anonymized.

h3. Workaround

-
fields.summary: Change the user deletion warning message

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User impersonation bypasses the product access restriction

h3. Environment
Jira and Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have user A a site-admin with access to both Confluence and Jira, and user B with access only in Confluence
# Add user B to the permission scheme of a project (browse projects permission) either directly or through a project role
# When user B attempts to visit the project, they will not have access to it because they don't have access to Jira
# When user A (the site-admin) impersonates user B, they will be able to see the project

h3. Expected Results
Impersonation should pick up the application access setting of the impersonated user

h3. Actual Results
The application access is bypassed by impersonation


h3. Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: user impersonation bypasses product access restriction

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Duplicate Cloud instance URL is listed in *[Products|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/general]* page under *Jira settings* section when the instance was migrated from Server > Cloud as they are 2 user directory in database

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a Server > Cloud migration of Jira data
* Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/general
* You should see a duplicate entries of the Cloud instance under *Jira setting* section
 !settings.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Each Cloud URL is showing once with no duplictae

h3. Actual Results
* Duplicate entries shown in under *Jira setting* section 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Duplicate Cloud instance entries in Products page

fields.description:
In the past we saw issues where G suites connection with atlassian was down and the Site Admin were not able to login to the Site or Jira with their accounts.

In such scenarios it would be nice if we can have a fallback options for users to do a non- gsuite login and access their site.

Only if site admins could have this ( and not all users) it will serve the purpose.
fields.summary: Ability for a Gsuite user to be able to do a Non Gsuite sign in if Gsuite is down

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment


 * Any production instance. E.g., chillistore-lqa.atlassian.net, hello, etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to user management and click through to "show details" for any user
 # In the list of groups on this screen, click elipsis next to any group and select "Remove user from group"
 # The prompt for confirmation reads: "
h4. Remove user?
You are about to remove user from confluence-users."

This looks OK in English, but the word "user" is hard-coded and does not get translated into other languages where this looks broken:

Japanese, for example:

"user さんを confluence-users から削除します。"

 

German:

"Sie sind dabei, user aus confluence-users zu entfernen."

 

This string is also used on the Group Management page and in that case the word "user" contains the actual username. This works fine as usernames don't need to be translated.

 

I suggest you place the username into the string in this case too for consistency and to remove complexity around translation.

 

If you prefer to keep the string "You are about to remove user from <group>", you need to create a new string with this text so that it can be translated and include the word "user".

 

 
h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results

Poor quality translation in any language other than English

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Hard-coded "user" prompt breaks translations for group management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some companies may consider the _atlassian-domain-verification=<token>_ a security risk since it is exposing to other the kind of service the company uses which can lead to unwanted attacks from malicious agents. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a token that doesn't show the Atlassian name such as _atl=<token>_ .
fields.summary: Anonymize Atlassian identification from the Domain Verification Token

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The account ID is used to replace the usernames due to the GDPR change. However, "Export Users" feature from User Management doesn't include the Account ID and it's still referring to the usernames.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Atlassian Accounts :

# Go to *User Management > User*
# Click *Export Users*
# *Download file*

Portal Only Customers

# Go to *User Management > > Jira Service Desk > Portal Only Customers*
# Click *Export Users*
# *Download file*




h3. Expected Results
The CSV file should include "Account ID" column

h3. Actual Results
"Account ID" is not included in the file

h3. Workaround
(i) *This workaround only applicable if the site has Jira installed*
Use Jira REST API calls to get the user details, including Account ID.
* [The Jira Cloud platform REST API - Get user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-user-get] 
** Returns details of a user.
* [The Jira Cloud platform REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-user-bulk-get]
** Returns details of the users specified in one or more user key, username, or user account ID parameters.
* [The Jira Cloud platform REST API - Bulk get users migration|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-user-bulk-migration-get]
** Returns account IDs for the users specified in one or more user key or username parameters.
fields.summary: "Export Users" function doesn't include the account IDs

fields.description:
In Atlassian we have the option via the site administration page to export site users and portal only users into CSV. They are still exporting username instead of AccountIds. 

- Site Administration > Users > Export
- Site Administration > Jira Service Desk > Portal Only Customers >Export

Please switch the users export to utilize AccountIds instead of usernames.
fields.summary: User export switch to AccountID

fields.description:
At the moment, the [Jira cloud rest api users|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-group-Users] endpoint does not cover the new [trusted users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/administer-users-for-a-site-938859733.html] feature. 

Please allow trusted users settings to be configurable via API as well.
fields.summary: Allow user rest api endpoint to include trusted functionality

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, when you add a user on Jira/Confluence Cloud at the _Site Administration_ page > _uesers_ > _Invite users_ by default after you type the email address, the following option will appear:
{code}
"Allow accounts on the <domain> domain to join your site"
{code}
!invite.png|thumbnail!

That happens even if your cloud _WHO CAN JOIN YOUR SITE_ option (site admin > *Product site*) is set to "Only invited users can join" hence you don't want to allow a specific domain to access the site. Having this message appearing by default might cause some confusion for the site admins.
!who.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solutions
Only show that "Allow accounts on the <domain> domain to join your site" option if the _WHO CAN JOIN YOUR SITE_ option is set to "Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join" hence, the user needs first to add a domain there then the suggestions would appear for new domains.
fields.summary: Disable the "Allow accounts on the <domain> domain to join your site" option when the "Only invited users can join" is enabled.
Ability to sync account details between Atlassian account and G Suite

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Summary

Only a part of the dropdown menu is visible. So Japanese users can tell which is which just after actually clicking the dropdown menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set your browser's language to Japanese
# Open user management page
# Click *すべてのユーザー* (All users) dropdown
# See both items state *サイトアクセスが...* (Site access is ...)

 !jac-ac-um.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The whole texts are visible.

h3. Actual Results

The texts are truncated.

h3. Notes

The tooltip should not be the best option in the dropdown menu. So consider widening the dropdown menu or using smaller font-size so that the whole texts become visible at first glance.
The approach of [Pseudo Localization @ Netflix|https://medium.com/netflix-techblog/pseudo-localization-netflix-12fff76fbcbe] might be helpful for native-English designers to ensure localized UX sustainably.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: The dropdown options of site access are truncated and become the same meaning in Japanese

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- Currently, Bitbucket subscription is not listed in the Overview of admin.atlassian.com Products list. 

h3. Suggested Solution
- As Atlassian access provides Company-wide visibility, control, and security; it would be beneficial to include Bitbucket subscription on the list.
fields.summary: Include Bitbucket on the list of Products in admin.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to user detail page
 # In the list of the groups the user belongs to, click the three-dot icon and select "Remove user from group"
# In the confirmation window, click "Cancel"

h3. Expected Results
The operation is cancelled

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Workaround
Click "Remove" and readd the user to group
fields.summary: Cancel button is not working when removing user from group

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After a Jira import is complete, regardless of whether the Outgoing mail is enabled or disabled, no email notifications will be sent to the imported users. However, the "Last seen on site" and "Status" shows a misleading message of "Invitation pending" and "Invited".
 !invited.png!

In addition to that, the "Resend Invite" also suggests that an invitation had been previously sent.
h3. Suggested Solution

For these users, change the wordings of the "Last seen on site" and "Status" to something else, such as "Not seen on this site" and "Has site access". The "Resend Invitation" should also be "Send Invite" instead.

On a related note, during the Jira import process, it is not stated whether the invitation emails are sent to the imported users (they will not be sent, regardless of whether Outgoing mail is enabled or disabled. see ID-6780). It would be great if we can also make this clear during the import process or after the import is completed.
h3. Why this is important

When performing imports, it is a common practice to perform test imports prior to the production import. During test imports, we would not want any emails to be sent out to users, as it would cause confusion.

The misleading wordings used in the Cloud's User Management would cause Site-Admins to be alarmed, fearing that their users had been sent email invitations during the test import process. These changes should then be reflecting the correct statuses of these users.
fields.summary: Improve wording of User's status after a Jira import is complete

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently any user with a valid email address is able to signup for an Atlassian account and verify it.

As the owner of domain and new accounts, organization admins should have the power to restrict account creation under claimed domain.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement the ability for organization admins to restrict account creation under the claimed domains.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict Atlassian account creation for claimed domain

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Checking the product usage at *Site Admin* > *Product access* we see the total of users that have access to the product (5 in the example below): 
!image.png|thumbnail!

But when you click that number link we got actually 3:
!image2.png|thumbnail!

The other 2 users that are not being displayed in the list are not part of the application default group (_confluence-users_ in this case) they are just _site-admins_ so they have application access and they are counting towards the billing but they are not being displayed as they have access to that product. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to <yoursite>.atlassian.com/admin
# Remove from the _site-admins_/_administrators_ the product default group (_confluence-users_ in this case). 
# The user will still have product access but will not be displayed in the product usage page. 
 
h3. Expected Results
All users with access to that product should be displayed on that page. 

h3. Solution / Workaround
You can have the full list of users with access to the product by exporting the active users' list with the *product access* checked.
fields.summary: New UI Product usage is not showing users that are only site-admins or administrators

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Admins are not losing *product access* when the admins' groups (_site-admins_ and _administrators_) are removed from the product default groups at the site administrator page > *Product access*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a site-admin, navigate to your <you_site>.atlassian.net/admin
# Click at *_Product access_* > remove _site-admins_ and _administrators_ groups from a product (Jira/Confluence).

h3. Expected Results
- The users under that group should lose access to that product. 
- Even if we remove the user from the product's default group they still count towards the application. 

h3. Solution / Workaround
- Remove the admins group at _Administration Access_ tab at the *Product access* page.
fields.summary: Admins are not losing product access when the admins groups are removed from the product default groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you grant a Product Access to a user using the green checkbox. The first time you do it, the green check box will be green but it will become gray when you access it again. Doing it the second time will make it stay green.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access User Details
# Grant Confluence Product Acces by toggling the switch

h3. Expected Results
* The green switch should stay and when you toggle it the first time.

h3. Actual Results
* Green switch for Product Access switches back the first time

h3. Workaround
Doing it the second time will keep the setting.
fields.summary: Green switch for Product Access switches back the first time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The customer is unable to find out when and which site-admin activated/deactivated a user in the instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to find out when and which site-admin activated/deactivated a user in the instance.

h3. Why this is important
Customers should be able to to find out when and which site-admin activated/deactivated a user in the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to view which site-admin activated/deactivated a user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- To get the list of all domain users that are registered Atlassian Account, you will need to verify your domain.

h3. Suggested Solution
- Provide an ability to get the list of users that are registered Atlassian Account.
fields.summary: Ability to get the list of Atlassian Accounts even if the domain is not verified.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When trying to add the members from the group's detail view, it would show a list of all users, including both with/without site access.
 !image-2019-03-20-09-31-32-668.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Option 1: Show only the users with site access
Option 2: Provide the option to filter the users based on the site access lik "Users" section:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
Option 3: Filter out users who are already a member of the group

h3. Why this is important
* This could cause confusion for admins when adding the members to the group
* This makes the admin difficult to go through the list when trying to add the members, especially when the company has hundreds or thousands of users

h3. Workaround
Use the "Search" box to look for the target user
fields.summary: Ability to filter the users when adding members to group

fields.description:
Sometimes, users are trying to access a link to a product for which they have not been given access.

For example, they might have been given the group membership which grants access to Jira Service Desk, but there is no active Service Desk subscription on the instance. So, when they click on the sign-up link to access the product, this error message is thrown.

Please improve the error message to be more meaningful, e.g to state lack of access rather than 'operation taking longer than usual'.
fields.summary: Improvements on error "Your operation is taking longer than usual" when customer has no access to the product

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users who used to be Trello users before User Provisioning does not show up under Managed Account tab

h3. Environment
Atlassian Access

h3. Expected Results
Users who used to be Trello users before User Provisioning should show up under the Managed Account tab

h3. Actual Results
Users who used to be Trello users before User Provisioning doesn't show up under the Managed Account tab
 
h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: User Provisioning issue with previous Trello users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All pages under [https://id.atlassian.com/manage] are loading blank on Google Chrome beta
h3. Environment

*Google Chrome Version 73.0.3683.75 (Official Build) beta (64-bit)*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to id.atlassian.com
 # Click on Security
 # Click on [Create and manage API tokens|https://id.atlassian.com/manage/api-tokens] or [View and manage recent devices|https://id.atlassian.com/manage/devices]
 # Blank page is showing

h3. Expected Results

Page loads successfully
h3. Actual Results

Page loading blank
h3. Workaround

Use a different browser, e.g Firefox
fields.summary: Blank page when loading Two step verification/API tokens/Recent devices/Billing details pages on id.atlassian.com on Chrome beta

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, a user will have to go through all the user to check for the "Trusted" label to find which users have this role in his organisation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a filter to check users under this role or include this information in the CSV of Export users.
fields.summary: Provide filter for "Trusted" users in Site administration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Billing menu item is replicated several times in the Subscriptions & Billing menu item

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-11 at 16.26.19.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Billing menu item is replicated in the User Management page

fields.description:
This group exists on the Cloud with the sole purpose of allowing Atlassian support engineers to assist our customers every time they face challenges with our products, but in some cases, customers were able to see this group and use it, to add users or set permissions for it, as the Cloud solution evolves, the group has been kept hidden throughout site administration and the products.

Customers used the group because it was simply visible or because they migrated from our Server version to the Cloud, the name of the group does not directly gives the lead that the group is exclusive for Atlassian support when on the Cloud and that causes confusion when the right to use it goes away, even though there are other groups customers will use for the same purpose.

h1. Suggestion
In order to avoid confusion to the fact that this group is not meant for customers on the Cloud, we should change the name of *system-administrators* or *confluence-administrators* group to *atlassian-administrators* or other purpose identifiable name.
fields.summary: Change the name of system-administrators/confluence-administrators group to atlassian-administrators

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Errors when adding users to groups or inviting users:

 !image-2019-03-08-15-28-35-236.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Go to site-administration page
 # Invite new user

h3. Expected Results
Able to invite users

h3. Actual Results
Not be able to add or invite users

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Unable to invite users and add users to groups

fields.description:
At this moment, the only way for admins to enforce a password policy is to have an Atlassian Access subscription.

Password policy is a security component, so please consider including it in the default cloud subscription, and not in Atlassian Access, which is a separate product
fields.summary: provide password policy as standard (and not with Atlassian Access)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * 5 groups listed in a user's profile page(User Management > Users > [User_profile])
 * Previously, 30 groups were listed on this page

h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to User Management > Users > [User_profile]

h3. Expected Results
 * Under "Groups"(or similar), 30 groups are listed there

h3. Actual Results
 * 5 groups are listed

h3. Workaround
 * Paginate through the different group lists
fields.summary: Increase the groups listed per page in a user's account profile page from 5 to 30 or more

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After disabling 2FA from a managed account from the managed accounts page the user behind that account may face difficulties to log in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Organization and verify a test domain
# Setup an account under the test domain and activated 2FA for it
# Disable 2FA for that account from the Organization

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to start a new session without passing through the 2FA requirements.

h3. Actual Results

The user is able to log in but gets redirected to https://id.atlassian.com/login/inactive as his account is inactive.
In the browser calls we can see that he's redirected to /inactive after the system fails to check his authentication policies:
{code}
https://id.atlassian.com/login/callback?email=example@test.com&errorCode=&error=unauthorized&error_description=check-auth-policies:authentication-checks-failed&state=XXXXJmVG9rZW4iOiJmZjU5NTM4MjBlZmIwZjk3YWJkY2ViOGJhYjgxYTQyMGU5ZjM1ZTQ0In0=
{code}

h3. Notes

In our tests, the issue was intermittent so it may not affect all accounts. 

h3. Workaround

Trigger a reset password email for the affected user at the below page:
* https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword
fields.summary: Users are facing login issues after the disablement of 2FA.

fields.description:
After a server to cloud migration, the admin managing the migration needs to inform their team to 

{quote}
# visit https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword 
# request a password reset
# Go to the inbox
# click on a link to setup a password. 
# then end-users can login. 
{quote}

With this flow, the on-boarding of end users takes a few clicks for each users.
It would be great if any of the following were possible
# Admins could set a default password for all their users 
# When users were added as a part of the site-import, send invitation emails to all users
# provide a REST endpoint so that admins can write a script to trigger the password reset requests. 

*Note* - In Atlassian Access, this is possible how it requires additional steps.
fields.summary: Allow admins to send password reset emails for their entire team

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As an admin, I noticed the message displayed in the section "What you need to know" of the page Site access is not always accurate.

For example if you have a set-up where you don't give any application access for new users, you won't be charged for users that self-signedup.

 !image-2019-03-04-19-18-42-901.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove application access in the Product access page
# In the Site access page, chose the second or third option (people from domain or anyone)
# Notice the message in the panel at the right side, "What you need to know"

h3. Expected Results
Users with no application access wont count towards the license

h3. Actual Results
The message says "Accounts created by self signup count towards your licence."

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
fields.summary: The message displayed in the page Site access saying new users count towards the license is not always accurate

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a site backup from Server/Cloud
# Import 1 to Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Admins will have an option to send an invitation to migrated users to notify them about the new site

h3. Actual Results
There will be no options to let the migrated users know about the new site

h3. Workaround
Please contact Atlassian Support to re-send the invitation to the users.
fields.summary: Ability to send invitations to users who are migrated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user has the new UI for the Manage Groups page, it only displays *the first 17 groups* of the list.

The other groups still existing but are only accessible when searching them. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Manage Groups page
# Add 17 groups. It'll display all the groups normally. 
# Add *one more group* and then +refresh the page+

h3. Expected Results
It should list the groups within one page or allow the user to navigate through other pages

h3. Actual Results
The *next page* icon is blocked.

h3. Notes
The group still existing. You only can't see it on the UI

h3. Workaround
# Search for the group is a workaround when *you know the group name*.
# At the developer tools check the call named *groups* at the *Network* tab, it should contain a JSON with all the instance groups data.
# Contact Atlassian Support to get the list of your existing groups.
fields.summary: New UI in Manage Groups only list one page of existing groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After connecting G Suite it's not possible to *Download your first sync summary*, and you're redirected to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/rest/gsync/um/report
 receiving 404 error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a G Suite account
 # Go to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin > *G Suite*
 # Connect G Suite
 # Then try to *Download your first sync summary*

h3. Expected Results

The summary download initiate.
h3. Actual Results

You receive this error message:

 !Switch back.png|thumbnail! 

Then you're automatically redirected to the page: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/rest/gsync/um/report

 !404.png|thumbnail!  

If you're able to hit the *Switch back* option you're redirected to the Old UI

 !Old UI.png|thumbnail!  

But the error will remain.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Download your first sync summary of G Suite sync returns 404 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For now, site-admins can only invite 5 new users per time. 
Previously, it did not matter how many users were being created at once.

Also, the message "Maximum of 5 users may be added at once.” only appears after you try inviting more than 5 users. 

It would be nice to have the ability to invite how many users you want with the new UI.
 
h3.Solution / Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Increase the invitation limit of users in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking the Atlassian logo in the User Management causes the page to refresh and show the old UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/
# Click Atlassian logo

 !image-2019-02-27-10-40-46-641.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
It should forward you to the home of the User Management

h3. Actual Results
It forwards you to the old UI.

h3. Notes
Considering the old UI is being deprecated, some actions are bugged. For example:
* clicking a user's name, in some cases, will get you back to the new UI - users list
* trying to open a system-user (addon) will get you back to the new UI
fields.summary: As a site-admin, when clicking Atlassian logo in the User Management I end up in the old UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the [API Tokens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html] documentation, it tells you to go to the *API Tokens* tab in order to click *Create API Token*

However, now the workflow is: Click on *Security*, under *API Tokens* click *Create and manage API tokens*

Additionally, the process past this part has changed even further, so we may need to rewrite the article.

 !Screen Shot 2019-02-26 at 12.13.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Correct the documentation to the new workflow

h3. Why this is important
Keeping documentation up-to-date is always important. This helps to deflect potential support tickets.
fields.summary: Update Documentation Regarding API Tokens

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are cases where admins using the "Suggest changes" feature are presented with the error "Something went wrong".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://instance.atlassian.net/admin/users]
 # Click "Show details" next to the user you want to suggest changes
 # Click "Suggest changes"
 # Type a new name
 # Click Suggest changes

h3. Expected Results

It should send an email to the user with the new name that was suggested
h3. Actual Results

The message "Something went wrong" is displayed
h3. Notes

The feature sends a single payload with both suggested name and email, and if you fail to type an email, the error will occur with a 400 status.
{noformat}
{"key":"fieldConstraintsViolated","context":{"fieldViolations":[{"field":"suggestChangeDetails.arg1.email.value","violations":[{"key":"Value is not a valid email address"}]}]}}
{noformat}
 !payload.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

In case you want to suggest just a name change, type also the same email.
fields.summary: As a site-admin, when I use the feature Suggest changes I got the error Something went wrong

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At the new UI of the cloud site administration is showing *Last seen on* at the users' profile at the *Has access on site* section when the user is disabled:
!image.png|thumbnail!

That information comes from the users' last authentication whenever the user attempt to access <your_company>.atlassian.net after authenticated (with an active session at https://id.atlassian.com) either through the UI or Jira/Confluence Mobile app .  

*Note:* that information also appears on the CSV user export file which can add cause more confusion.

h3. Environment
Cloud -  [new site admin UI|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/07/we-re-making-the-future-for-cloud-admins]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to your site administration page (i.e. <yoursite>.atlassian.net/admin)
# Click on *Users* then click on *Show details* or *...* > *Show details*
# You will see the information at *Has access on site* section

h3. Expected Results
That field should display the last time that use accessed the Jira/Confluence instance (as the UI suggests) and when he/she has access/is active on that cloud site. 

h3. Actual Results
It is displaying the last time the user that is authenticated agains Atlassian attempts to access the instance. 
 
h3.Solution / Workaround
Validate if the user is active in the instance before updating that field.
fields.summary: Users' profile at site administration is showing confusing information

fields.description:
Currently, we have three defaults for users Permissions:
 - Basic: assigns jira-software-users, jira-servicedesk-users, jira-core-users, confluence-users
 - Trusted: assigns jira-software-users, jira-servicedesk-users, jira-core-users, confluence-users and administrators
 - Site administrator: assigns jira-software-users, jira-servicedesk-users, jira-core-users, confluence-users and site-admin

h3. The Suggestion

At this moment, *trusted* user is the default value when you invite a new user. It would be nice if admins could choose which permission level would be the default value for new invites.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to configure default Permission when inviting new users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is a limit of 10 users that can be invited at the same time in the instance.

h3. Suggested Solutions
There are use cases where the admin invites batches of users, in some cases way more than 10 users. It would be great and convenient to be able to invite more users.

h3. Workaround
Bulk adding users can be done through REST API using the endpoint 'Create user' -- POST /rest/api/3/user.

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-user-post
fields.summary: As an instance admin I would like to invite more than 10 users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the Groups page you can view which products gives product access. 
If you add jira-administrators group to a product (say Jira Software) and return to the Groups page, it will still show as no product access. See the video below.

 [^Screen Recording 2019-02-21 at 10.42 AM.mov] 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* go to the Groups page and check the product access of the group jira-administrators
* go to the Product access page and add the jira-administrators group to the product access
* go back to the Groups page and refresh

h3. Expected Results
* jira-administrators should be marked as having product access

h3. Actual Results
* nothing changed

h3. Notes
If you add jira-administrators group to administration access it will work, the problem is only on product access

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Groups page is not reflecting Access to product correctly - jira-administrators group appear as no product access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who are utilizing IdP Initiated Login are redirected to the Atlassian ID page to authenticate before they're able to access their Cloud Instance/Product

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option to bypass/skip the ID Login page if the login was initiated on the Identity Provider side; ex: One-Click to login from the IdP

h3. Why this is important
Bring the same experience that a User may be familiar to as many other SAML/SSO integrations utilize a 'one-click' login when initiated on the IdP side
 
h3. Workaround 
Input Email Address and the User will login to their Cloud Instance/Product
fields.summary: Skip the Atlassian ID Login Screen during IdP Initiated Login

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After a cloud import, default groups does not appear to be selected on Product access > Administration access.

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Import a cloud site
* Go to Site administration > Product access > Administration access
* Type "administrators" to add the default administrators group

h3. Expected Results
* It should display the administrators group in order to be selected

h3. Actual Results
* The administrators group doesn't appear to be selected

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
Recreate the group. After deleting and creating again, the group will display there.
fields.summary: Administration access not working in the new UI - Cannot add groups after import

fields.description:
h3. Problem
On the old user management view, when the customer had an Atlassian account and a porta-only account with the same email. Jira used to show a warning message asking the site-admin to migrate the account to an Atlassian account and merge both accounts. This is not gone now with the new User Management look.
 !portalonly.jpg|thumbnail! 

This brings problems to JSD projects, where the agent cannot receive notifications or access to certain pages.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Have some kind of message, showing the site-admins that there are duplicate accounts. Add "duplicate accounts" on the filtered by drop-down.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-18 at 18.39.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bring back the duplicate customer warning message

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
_Time zone_ field in Atlassian Account displays the option for capital of Ukraine as "Kiev".  however the correct spelling of this word is "Kyiv". Please see the screenshot below:
 !Atlassian Account - Time zone.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested solution
Please update and correct the spelling.
fields.summary: Correction in timezone translation

fields.description:
On the old UI on User Management, site-admins has the ability to set the invitation expiry when inviting new users.

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-7198

This no longer exists in the new User Management page. It would be great if we keep this feature in the new UI.
fields.summary: Ability to configure token expiry of invites in the new User Management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This bug ticket is created in accordance to the disclaimer in https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-your-site-homepage-873871363.html . It will allow customers to be able to track the progress of the fix.

 !image-2019-02-15-19-30-21-029.png|thumbnail! 

As of now, it is not possible to set the landing page of a Cloud instance.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It is not possible to set the landing page via user management currently

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As stated in [Secure your account with two\-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html], one of the ways to set up 2FA for our Atlassian account is by using SMS services.

However, U.S. law prohibits Atlassian, an Australian corporation with offices in the United States, from providing access to our products and services to organizations or End Users located in the following countries and regions; Crimea Region of Ukraine, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, Sudan.

Because it is not possible to block the SMS services of the specific region of Crimea, as a result all Ukraine numbers are blocked.

In addition to that, the Crimea region has already begun to adopt Russian phone numbers (+7) instead of Ukraine phone numbers (+38) as also stated in [Telephone numbers in Russia \- Wikipedia|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_Russia].

h3. Suggested Solution
Unblock Ukraine numbers since Crimea is now using Russian phone numbers.
fields.summary: Unblock Crimean Phone Numbers for SMS services.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

There used to be a role viewer in the user management that allows users to check user roles and access directly from the user management.

!JIRA+Project+Roles.png|thumbnail!

While there is a permission checker in place, the permission checker do not provide a higher level view on the user access/roles, it's project level view so users can't be sure if the specific user they are checking have access or roles in other projects in the JIRA instance.

For the ease of configuring user roles and access, please also include or return the role viewer feature in the user management.

As a workaround, the page can be accessed using the URL https://domain.atlassian.net/secure/admin/roles/ViewUserProjectRoles.jspa?name=admin
fields.summary: Bring back role viewer in the new user management view

fields.description:
In the old User Management page, a site-admin could see system users as well.

In the new User Management page, system users are no longer shown. This feature (seeing the system users as well) is handy for experienced site-admins that would like to retrieve information about who performed an action from the audit log or the issue history.
fields.summary: site-admins can no longer see system users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Just one more step to go!" message still appears even though SAML is correctly configured.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-14 at 13.17.05.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution
Find a way to hide/mute the message once SAML has been successfully configured.

h3. Why this is important
Can be confusing for admins as it seems like the setup process isn't fully completed/they've missed a configuration step.
 
h3. Workaround 
No known workarounds.
fields.summary: SAML: "Just one more step to go!" notification isn't muted when SAML is configured correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, if you are an org admin and you delete a cloud site, all Atlassian accounts of that site still remains in the Managed accounts of the organization.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add an option for org admins choose to keep or delete the Atlassian accounts upon deleting the site.
fields.summary: Give org admins the ability to also delete the Atlassian accounts when deleting a cloud site

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users cannot change their profile pictures from their instance profile settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access your user profile under the people directory of your instance.

The URL should be something like this:
{noformat}
https://{instance}.atlassian.net/people/{externald}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The user profile image should display a change icon as it does in Chrome or Firefox:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-07 at 18.28.54.png! 

h3. Actual Results
No option is showed and nothing happens when clicking the image.

h3. Notes
* The profile picture can't be changed even from https://id.atlassian.com
* It can be removed but not changed.
 
h3.Workaround
NA
fields.summary: Can't change the profile picture(avatar) from people directory of the instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to access the billing page inside the User Management, I got this page with the error "We can't load this page right now".
 !errorpage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Be sure to be part of the *site-admins* group, so the *Site Administration* content can be accessed
# Click on the *Application Navigator > Site Administration*
# Click on *Billing* on the sidebar and select any of the options (e.g. Manage subscriptions)

h3. Expected Results
The content of the page should be loaded

h3. Actual Results
No content is loaded. Only the "We can't load this page right now" information is displayed.

h3. Notes
* Error in the console
{code:none| borderColor=#6A8EB3}
{"exception":"com.atlassian.billing.ux.infra.ClientException","path":"/api/billing/bill-estimate","trace":"b6f5450de545fa7f","error":"Internal Server Error","message":"HTTP 500 Server Error for (GET) https://billing-api-gateway.prod.atl-paas.net/api/entitlement-groups/04ee47d7-8720-49ed-9a90-af3a9cf840f1/bill-estimate","timestamp":"2019-02-12T20:21:19.291+0000","status":500,"span":"819840f8ac30373d"}
{code}
* Error in network tab
{code:none| borderColor=#6A8EB3}
{"timestamp":"2019-02-12T20:48:11.374+0000","status":500,"error":"Internal Server Error","exception":"com.netflix.zuul.exception.ZuulException","message":"GENERAL"}
{code}
* This happened in the past, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68082

h3. Workaround
* accessing the browser through incognito mode
* accessing using a different browser
* clear all the cache/cookies tied to the Atlassian products
fields.summary: Can't access Billing page - Error: We can't load this page right now

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you add a cloud site to an organization, your site-admins are "merged" with org admins. After that, you cant add new site-admins from the User Management UI, only from the Organization > Administrators.

 !siteadmins.png|thumbnail! 

For example, if you go to the site-admins group, the buttons to add will be greyed out. In the other hand, if you go to a user profile and try to add him to the site-admins group, this group wont appear in the search results.

You can, however, use the Trusted functionality and select *Site administrator* and the user will be added as a site-admin.

 !image-2019-02-12-15-06-22-310.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Access
* Organization

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an org
# Verify domain
# Add a cloud site
# In the instance User Management, click *Site administrator* in the Trusted settings of the user profile

h3. Expected Results
# The user shouldn't be added as a site-admin OR the user should also be added as an org admin

h3. Actual Results
# The user is added as a site-admin and not as an org admin.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
You can change the permissions to Trusted or Basic in order to remove them from the site-admins group.
fields.summary: Trusted feature can bypass Organization restrictions and add users to site-admins group that are not Organization admins
